oracle.apps.saf.ta.jaudit.core
Class AbstractXmlAnalyzer

java.lang.Object
  oracle.jdeveloper.audit.analyzer.Analyzer
      oracle.apps.saf.ta.jaudit.core.AbstractAnalyzer
          oracle.apps.saf.ta.jaudit.core.AbstractXmlAnalyzer
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractWorkspaceOrphanAnalyzer
public abstract class AbstractXmlAnalyzer
extends AbstractAnalyzer

The core base class for XML Analyzers in SAF All SAF based analyzers that process XML must extend from this class. It provides support for annotation based visitor enablement based on the Document and Element. Sub-class can declare enterElement methods with AuditElement annotation to specify elements to visit. When visiting elements, only enterElement methods which has AuditElement annotation with matched local name and namespace are called. And then the default enter element method (enter(context, element) without annotation) is called, if it is defined. You can specify element local name and name using Regular Expression. For example,

See Also:
AuditFileExtensions, AuditXmlDocumentNodeClass, AuditElement, JspNodeUxAnalyzer.java for a detailed example.

public java.util.List<org.w3c.dom.Element> doXPath(org.w3c.dom.Element element,
                                                   java.lang.String commonCatalogXpath,
                                                   oracle.apps.ta.dt.core.xpath.TaNamespaceContext nsContext)
Required method to execute Xpath. The TaXPath project cannot refere to the {code ErrorReporter}. This method allows for easy invocation of XPath and consistent reporting of any failures.

Parameters:
element -
commonCatalogXpath -
nsContext -
Returns:
A list of Elements that were matched.

Fetches a object matching an expression.

Parameters:
